project.teaser: The general objective of the RECREATE project is to develop a set of innovative technologies aimed at exploiting the potential of End-of-Life (EoL) complex composite waste as feedstock for profitable reuse of parts and materials in the manufacturing industry. In the light of...
project.title: REcycling technologies for Circular REuse and remanufacturing of fiber-reinforced composite mATErials
project.keywords: Reuse, remanufacturing, recycling, reprocessing, solvolysis, vitrimers, reversible adhesives, demonstrators, process optimization, circular economy, decision-support systems, end of life

article.title: Innovative recycling for end-of-life composite waste

programme.title: Ensuring circularity of composite materials (Processes4Planet Partnership) (RIA)

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Optimization of a chemical recycling process for epoxy-amine thermosets and their carbon fiber reinforced composites using a design of experiments approach

details.authors: Valeria De Fabritiis, Leonardo Matta, Gianmarco Griffini, Stefano Turri

result.title: Revisiting Unsaturated Polyesters: Recyclable-by-Design Vinylester Resins for the Circular Economy

details.authors: Giulia Altamura, Eleonora Manarin, Gianmarco Griffini, Stefano Turri

result.title: Innovation management programme
result.description: This deliverable will report the work of task T6.1 regarding the technology concepts that will be verified in a controlled environment and designed in innovation workshops. The report will include information on the component and breadboard validation in relevant environment that will be carried out for each tested technology. A circularity assessment tool will be developed and applied.

result.title: Co-design of relevant teaching methodologies
result.description: This deliverable will report the work of task T7.1 concerning the co-design of innovative learning/teaching methods in the field of composite circularity. The report will be focused on the definition of relevant Guidelines for Teaching Methodologies and Strategies for the RECREATE project.

result.title: Fully biobased epoxy vitrimers from phloroglucinol triglycidyl ether and 2,5-furandicarboxylic acid

details.authors: Giulia Altamura, Marta Mazzucchelli, Eleonora Manarin, Anastasiia Nosova, Gianmarco Griffini, Stefano Turri

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - RECREATE (REcycling technologies for Circular REuse and remanufacturing of fiber-reinforced composite mATErials)
result.teaser: The overall objective of the RECREATE project is to develop a set of innovative technologies aimed at exploiting the circularity potential of End-of-Life (EoL) complex composite waste (mainly carbon fiber reinforced composites CFRC, and glass fiber reinforced composites GFRC)...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: On the Definition, Assessment, and Enhancement of Circular Economy across Various Industrial Sectors: A Literature Review and Recent Findings
Viability of recycled fibres extracted from EoL composites

details.journalTitle: IOP Conference Series: Materials Science and Engineering

result.title: Project website launched and running
result.description: This deliverable will report the work of task T8.1 concerning the project website setup, lunch and monitoring of the website. The outcomes will include website design as well as its implementation and curation.

result.title: Reversible resins for FRC repair and reuse
result.description: This deliverable will report the work of task T4.4 concerning the design and development of reversible resins to be used as matrix materials in FRCs for repair and reuse. The report will include a detailed characterization of the properties of the selected materials and of their performance.

result.title: Preparation of rGF and rCF and supply for demonstrators
result.description: This deliverable will report the work of task T3.1 an T3.2 concerning the reclamation of rGF and rCF from electrofragmentation and catalyst-assisted low-temperature green solvolysis. The output will be the supply of rGF and RCF for demonstrators.

result.title: Towards a zero-waste chemcycling of thermoset polymer composites: Catalyst assisted mild solvolysis for clean carbon fiber liberation and circular coating development

details.authors: Eleonora Manarin, Oussama Boumezgane, Angela Giannino, Valeria De Fabritiis, Gianmarco Griffini, Stefano Turri

result.title: Mapping and assessment of complex EoL composite waste stream
result.description: This deliverable will report the work of task T1.1 concerning the analysis, mapping and assessment of the EoL composite waste material streams in Europe in terms of composition, volumes, availability and locations, covering different relevant industrial sectors.

result.title: Bio-Based Vitrimers from 2,5-Furandicarboxylic Acid as Repairable, Reusable, and Recyclable Epoxy Systems

details.authors: Eleonora Manarin, Federico Da Via, Benedetta Rigatelli, Stefano Turri, and Gianmarco Griffini

result.title: Project inclusion and transdisciplinarity
result.description: "This deliverable will report the work of task T9.4 and will consist of a report detailing the activities of the ""Inclusion Committee"". The first release of the report will be at M12 and further updates will be at M24, M36 and M48."

result.title: Exploiting High Voltage Fragmentation to Enable Demand-Driven Recycling of End-of-Life Wind Blades

details.authors: Marco Diani; Shravan Torvi; Marcello Colledani

result.title: Diels-Alder Macromolecular Networks in Recyclable, Repairable and Reprocessable Polymer Composites for the Circular Economy – A Review

details.authors: Gianmarco Griffini, Benedetta Rigatelli, Stefano Turri

result.title: Guidelines for design of reversible joining in next-gen FRC parts
result.description: This deliverable will report the work of task T4.2 concerning the design of reversible joining solutions as a key factor for reuse of components and recycling. The report will deal with different adhesives and their possible performance if considering not only the use phase, but also the dismantling of a product.

category.title: recycling
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/waste management/waste treatment processes/recycling

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
